result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tommy L Knutowski in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  
Court to Address:  Status of Competency - Evaluation Prepared by Dr. Peissig.

Dr. Peissig's competency report now finds that the defendant is competent to proceed.
Both the State and Defense have received copies of the evaluation.
Neither the State or Defense are contesting the finds or requesting an additional evaluation.
Court Finds the defendant is competent to proceed at this time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Dr. Emily Peissig, Wisconsin Department of Health Services.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED - Order of Commitment for Treatment (incompetency).
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 04/05/22,

Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency).
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 04/04/22.
Review hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tommy L Knutowski in court with attorney Cassandra A Miller.  
Cases:  21CF1518, 21CF1710 & 22CM421 all called together.
Court to Address:  Competency Evaluation prepared by Dr. Niess (Not Currently Competent but Likely to Regain Within the Statutory Time Frame and Not Competent to Refuse Medications).

Both the State and the Defense have received a copy of Dr. Niess's Evaluation.
Neither the State or Defense are contesting the findings or requesting a Second Evaluation.
Court finds the defendant is not currently competent, but likely to regain within the statutory time frame.
Court will also find the defendant is not competent to refuse medications.
Court will commit the defendant to the Department of Health Services for treatment to competency.
Court will grant 163 days credit on case 21CF1517, 155 days credit on case 21CF1710 & 25 days credit on 22CM421
Court will order the defendant transported as soon as there is an available bed space available at either Mendota or Winnebago.
Court signed Order of Commitment for Treatment on all cases. 
  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Dr. Jenna Niess, 3/28/22
Review hearing on April 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
